intro: Diplotaxis virgata var. genuina, commonly known as the African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features basal leaves that are rhombic or ovate with wavy margins and a rough texture. Its flowers are yellow and borne in a single head, followed by a crown of bracts that resemble a dandelion seed head. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
